channel.title: Unable to connect
channel.description: What would be the reason im unable to connect to the server, It works at home, But here i just cant seem to connect, Anyone have any suggestions to bypass this? Thanks.

item.title: Unable to connect
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I don’t know, you are just going to have to find what ports you can access from work and let me know.

item.title: Unable to connect
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The port I used for minecraft was 1863, can you connect to that one?

iptables -t nat -I PREROUTING -p tcp --destination 69.39.224.49 --dport 1863 -j DNAT --to-destination 69.39.224.49:25565

edit:
Oh, sorry I wasn’t clearer. Try to connect to 69.39.224.49:1863, maybe with telnet or something?

telnet 69.39.224.49 1863

and tell me if that works.

Read full topic

item.title: Unable to connect
item.dc:creator: @elyad elyad
item.description:
@elyad wrote:

Thanks, I would appreciate that, As id like to try and connect during work hours in the background if i can.

Read full topic

item.title: Unable to connect
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Assuming your problem is that outgoing ports are filtered, it shouldn’t be a problem when I start hosting the server. Some people had the same issue with the minecraft server, but determined they could connect to the port normally used for MSN, so I just used iptables to forward that port to the actual port, I can do the same for you.

Read full topic

item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“elyad, post:1, topic:430815”]What would be the reason im unable to connect to the server, It works at home, But here i just cant seem to connect, Anyone have any suggestions to bypass this? Thanks.[/quote]Where is ‘here’?

Is the network you’re on strict on which ports you can connect to, is there any type of [reverse] proxy, etc?
